result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for status conference.  The status conference was held in person.  Defense requesting additional time to review the case in Spanish with her client. Defense is requesting a bail review.  The court grants defense request and order the matter adjourned to Branch 28.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in custody.   Kathryn Ginsberg for Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held in person.  Defense has discovery, state to follow-up with an offer.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 25 in person.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez and Alberto Alguilar. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Garrett Bong - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Juan Carlos Alanis not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Interpreter was unavailable for today's hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered no contact with CS, Juana C-M or her children.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $100,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Monitoring is 24 hour curfew.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Juan Carlos Alanis in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Sworn Spanish Interpreter: Daniel Lopez.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
